title: How to Make Raspberry Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.title: Preheat your oven to 375 째F (191 째C).
steps.content: Preheat your oven to 375 째F (191 째C).

steps.title: Grease and line a cookie sheet.
steps.content: Grease and line a cookie sheet. Use a dash of butter to grease the cookie sheet, and line it with baking parchment,

steps.title: Cream the butter and sugars together.
steps.content: Cream the butter and sugars together. In a large mixing bowl, put the butter and sugar, and use a hand mixer or a wooden spoon to cream the ingredients.

steps.title: Beat in the eggs and vanilla.
steps.content: Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Crack in the eggs and pour in the vanilla extract to the mixture and mix in.

steps.title: Combine the dry ingredients.
steps.content: Combine the dry ingredients. Put the flour, salt, and baking soda in a separate bowl and mix together to combine.

steps.title: Mix the dry ingredients into wet ones.
steps.content: Mix the dry ingredients into wet ones. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ones. Continue mixing all of them together until they're well combined.

steps.title: Fold in the chocolate chips and raspberries.
steps.content: Fold in the chocolate chips and raspberries. Add the chocolate chips and raspberries to the dough and fold in gently, making sure not to smash the raspberries.

steps.title: Put the cookies on a prepared cookie sheet.
steps.content: Put the cookies on a prepared cookie sheet. Take tablespoonfuls of cookie dough and roll them into balls. Arrange on a greased baking sheet, making sure there is plenty of space for cookies to spread as you bake.

steps.title: Bake the cookies.
steps.content: Bake the cookies. Put your cookies in the preheated oven for 10 minutes until golden.

steps.title: Let the cookies cool.
steps.content: Let the cookies cool. Put the cookies on a wire rack until they are fully cooled. Then, move them to your cookie jar or wherever you wish to store them.
